intro: Silene yarmalii var. gillii, commonly known as the Yarmal's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid environments. It is a perennial herb that produces small, clustered flowers, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
